abstract: New York private investigator Eric Saldarriaga, who was convicted on charges of illegally hacking email accounts, is sentenced to three months in prison, despite questions about prosecution's handling of case.
lead_paragraph: Two victims and the judge in the case question why prosecutors did not give the victims more details about the private investigator’s illicit activities.

headline.main: Investigator Gets 3 Months in Prison in Hacking Case
headline.print_headline: Investigator Gets 3 Months in Prison in Hacking Case

snippet: Two victims and the judge in the case question why prosecutors did not give the victims more details about the private investigator’s illicit activities.
